learning.title: Welcome to school (Part 1)
learning.subtitle: Lesson 3: Communication
learning.desc: By the end of this lesson, students will have (a) been introduced to 2 new vocabulary words; and (b) reviewed and practised using vocabulary in sentence patterns relating to emotions in the context of the topic of “My Kindergarten”.

list.stage: To get kids in fun, active mood and thinking English

list.text: Greet the children, brightly, with a big smile, "Hello, how are you?".
Ask children to stand up, gesturing the action with your hands and saying clearly and slowly "Everyone, stand up!".
Say <i>"Hello, How Are You?"

Begin with "I'm fine, I'm good, I'm really great" for Round 1, "I'm tired, I'm sad, I'm not so good" for Round 2, repeat "I'm fine, I'm good, I'm really great" for Round 3, and then "I'm sleepy, I'm shy, I'm really sad". Repeat one more time.
Clap and praise the children and encourage them to clap too. Tell them: "That was great!" with a big thumbs up with each hand.
Tell children to sit down, gesturing the action with your hands and saying clearly and slowly, "Everyone, sit down!"

list.stage: Introduce classroom management system Set context for the lesson and generate interest in the topic and see what kids already know about it

list.text: Review Classroom Rules via H5P Activity #1.
Remind the children of the theme: "Today we are going to continue talking about our school.".

Ask the children questions to refresh their memory from the previous lesson. For example "What words did we learn last time?" Questions may be presented and answered in Vietnamese if the questions are a bit complicated.

list.lesson:
Introduce & Review Key Vocabulary, Sentence Patterns & Communication Skills
10 mins
list.stage: Show how the Key Vocabulary is used within the set context of "My Kindergarten"

list.text: Using Flashcards, introduce the key vocabulary using H5P Activity # 2.
Test students' prior knowledge. Allow them time to attempt to say the Key words before saying the words.
Ask students to repeat the word after you. If a child doesn't want to repeat the word, that is ok. Give them time to gain confidence.
Use an Attention Getter to get the children's attention. When they are paying attention, praise them for completing the activity and tell them, clearly and slowly, “Everyone, sit down!”
Once the children are all sitting and paying attention, refer back to the Classroom Rules and Reward students who followed the behaviour rules during the activity with stars.

list.lesson: How to Refer Back to the CRM & Award Rewards

procedures.text:
Praise children for trying, not just for correct answers. We will revisit the vocabulary, now is the time for children to enjoy, gain confidence and want to try.
Never take stars away from a child- that is negative reinforcement and doesn't work well. Simply award MORE stars to children who did behave and did try. Tell those who didn't that if they behave and follow the Class Rules and try in the next activity, then you can give them more stars, and you'd love to do that! Really encourage them to want to try.
For the same reasons, never give stars for winning or getting an answer correct - always for good behaviour and for trying. Otherwise, the stronger children get all the rewards and the children who need more support get discouraged and stop trying.

list.stage: Use different activities to give children repeated exposure to meaning of the vocabulary and sentence patterns. Bear in mind their very short focus at this age, and that they need to be having fun and learning through play that engages and interests them for a few minutes at a time, at least.

list.text: Explain H5P Activity #3 (in Vietnamese if necessary)
Demo Activity #3
Ask ICQs (in Vietnamese if necessary)
Proceed with the activities taking turns allowing different children to try. Remember not to force children to try, allow them to gain confidence over time.
Use an Attention Getter to get the children's attention. When they are paying attention, praise them for completing the activity and tell them, clearly and slowly, “Everyone, sit down!”
Once the children are all sitting and paying attention, refer back to the Classroom Rules and Reward students who followed the behaviour rules during the activity with stars. Check Understanding.
Repeat steps 1 - 6 for H5P Activity #4
